quotes.quote: Those who wish to sing always find a song.
Since the days of slavery, if you were a good singer or dancer, it was your job to perform for the master after dinner.
A singer ... is no more than an actor set to music.
Singers provide all the proof that we have souls.
It's easy for a singer to sometimes pick up on another singer's sound, but that's just copying.
When you make your living as a singer, you have to go where the gigs are.
You can cage the singer but not the song.
Popular culture is a place where pity is called compassion, flattery is called love, propaganda is called knowledge, tension is called peace, gossip is called news, and auto-tune is called singing.
The activity of a singer that sings opera is similar to that of an athlete.
The singer has everything within him.  The notes come out from his very life.  They are not materials gathered from outside.
I don't sing because I'm happy; I'm happy because I sing.
There is delight in singing, though none hear beside the singer.
It's better if a singer disconnects from the original and brings something new to the version.
He who sings scares away his woes.
If I cannot fly, let me sing.
A song should stand on its own and on what a singer does with it. It shouldn't need a lot of extra help to be good.
Your voice is like a very serious instrument that you have to tame if you want to be an amazing singer - Marvin Gaye or Michael Jackson.
A great song can make a terrible singer sound good, but a good singer - you put a great song on top of that, you're really in great shape!
All the intelligence and talent in the world can't make a singer. The voice is a wild thing. It can't be bred in captivity. It is a sport, like the silver.
In the life of a singer, it's not all triumphs and happy memories; there are days you have to go out there when it's the last thing you feel like doing.
I'm not only a SINGER, I'm an ENTERTAINER... I make people dance away their sorrow and I put smiles on people face
Life is too short to sing music you don't love.
If I'm going to sing like someone else, then I don't need to sing at all.
A singer starts by having his instrument as a gift from God... When you have been given something in a moment of grace, it is sacrilegious to be greedy.
When you have your own identity as a singer, you don't have competition.
There's no half-singing in the shower, you're either a rock star or an opera diva.
